My Projects

The Java Handbook

The Java Handbook is one of my oldest projects, written in Java, to be used for Java coding. The idea is that as I learn the language, I add pages to the program as a form of note taking. That way when I'm coding, I have this program open to easily reference the syntax and usage of a function. Over the past four years, I have continuously added to the program and continue to update it to this day.

The Python Handbook

The Python Handbook is the exact same as The Java Handbook, but is built in Python, to be used during Python coding. I find it very nice to have programs like this that give me quick refreshers on syntax and modules. The Python Handbook is still in it's infancy stages and is fairly new. I begun working on it in 2017, and there is still alot more to add as I become more comfortable with the Python Language.

The Python Handbook is coded in Python, using primarily the Tkinter module, with a little of the extended ttk module worked in. When Python was a fairly new language to me, I started by learning basic syntax, then immediatly begun the process of creating the handbook to log my progress. The version included below is new and refreshed as of August 2019. I restarted from scratch after realising that I could restructure the original to make it easier to read and maintain. Currently, the only inlcuded modules are Tkinter and layout managing information, however I'm working to add other commonly used modules, such as Raspberry Pi GPIO and Socket Servers.

LAN TicTacToe

LAN TicTacToe is a minigame I created in Java that features multiplayer hosting and connecting via the Java Socket Server class. This program was my first dive into simple networking. The app allows the user to host a game or connect to one as a client over a Local Area Network. After opening a socket with which to communicate, the client and host will essentially send and receive messeages that dictate every move made on the gameboard. Once someone wins, the entire board is reset for rematches.
